message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV 

The paper deals with natural language processing tasks and neural networks, which are typically covered in the categories of computational linguistics (cs.CL), machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), neural networks (cs.NE), and computer vision (cs.CV). The focus on character-level language models and unsegmented text suggests a stronger emphasis on computational linguistics and machine learning, hence cs.CL and cs.LG are the most likely categories. However, the paper also discusses the cognitive aspects of language learning, which could potentially fall under cs.AI and cs.NE. Finally, the mention of tracking word boundaries could relate to text segmentation and recognition, which is a common topic in computer vision and could justify the inclusion of cs.CV as a possible category.
